things.config

Class ThingReaders

  • java.lang.Object
    • things.config.ThingReaders

  • public class ThingReaders
extends Object

    Collection class for all ThingReaders that are used in this application.

    Readers are registered using a matcher-string in the format:

    [type-matcher]/[key-matcher]

    That means, for example if you want to add a reader for all things of type ‘person’, you’d register the reader using:

    person/*

    If you only have one reader for your whole application, you can just add it via:

    * / * (without white-spaces)

    If you want to use a reader for all things of type ‘person’, where the person key ends with ‘a’, you could do:

    person/*a

    And so on…

    • Constructor Detail

      • ThingReaders

        public ThingReaders()

    • Method Detail

      • addReader

        public void addReader(String matcher,
                      ThingReader reader)

        Add a reader and register it against a type/key-matcher.

        Parameters:
        matcher - the matcher (e.g. ‘person/‘), if the 2nd part of the matcher is omitted (e.g. ‘person’), ’/’ will be added (resulting in: ‘person/*’)
        reader - the reader object

      • get

        public Set<ThingReader> get(String queryType,
                            String queryKey)

        Get all readers that match the specfied type/key combination.

        Both type and key in put can be a glob, but don’t need to be. Whether or not a reader is returned depends on the outcome of a two-way match of registered matcher-token of the reader and the specified type/key combination.

        Parameters:
        queryType - the query type or type matcher
        queryKey - the query key or key matcher
        Returns:
        a set of all readers that are a match

      • getAll

        public Set<ThingReader> getAll()

        Returns all registered readers.

        Used to get all things, application-wide.

      • getThingReadersMatchingKey

        public Set<ThingReader> getThingReadersMatchingKey(String queryKey)

        Convenience method to get all readers that match the specified key.

      • getThingReadersMatchingType

        public Set<ThingReader> getThingReadersMatchingType(String queryType)

        Convenience method to get all readers that match the specified type.

      • getUnique

        public ThingReader getUnique(String queryType,
                             String queryKey)

        Get the single reader that matches the specfied type/key combination.

        Both type and key in put can be a glob, but don’t need to be. Whether or not a reader is returned depends on the outcome of a two-way match of registered matcher-token of the reader and the specified type/key combination.

        Parameters:
        queryType - the query type or type matcher
        queryKey - the query key or key matcher
        Returns:
        the unqiue reader that matches the specfied type/key combination
        Throws:
        things.exceptions.TypeRuntimeException - if no, or multiple readers are found for the specified type/key combination

      • getUnique

        public ThingReader getUnique(things.thing.Thing child)

        Convenience method to get the unqiue reader that can be used to read the specified Thing.

        Uses getUnique(things.thing.Thing).
